skill.name: xlsx
skill.description: Spreadsheet toolkit (.xlsx/.csv). Create/edit with formulas/formatting, analyze data, visualization, recalculate formulas, for spreadsheet processing and analysis.
skill.summary: Spreadsheet toolkit (.xlsx/.csv). Create/edit with formulas/formatting, analyze data, visualization,...

security_audit.summary: The skill recalculates local Excel files using LibreOffice and scans for formula errors. No credential access, network calls, or data exfiltration patterns were found.

content.value_statement: Formulas in Excel files can be stale or error prone after edits. This skill recalculates formulas and reports error locations for quick fixes.
actual_capabilities: Recalculate all formulas in an Excel file using LibreOffice headless mode
Create a LibreOffice macro for automated recalculation
Scan all sheets for Excel error strings and list their locations
Report total error count and a per error type summary
Count total formulas in the workbook
limitations: Requires LibreOffice installed and accessible as soffice
Operates on local files only and does not edit formulas
Recalculation can time out on very large workbooks
Macro setup writes to the user LibreOffice profile directory

use_cases.title: Validate model integrity
use_cases.description: Recalculate a model after updates and locate #REF or #DIV/0 errors before sharing.

use_cases.title: Quality check exports
use_cases.description: Verify that exported workbooks have no formula errors before delivery.

use_cases.title: Spot spreadsheet issues
use_cases.description: Run a quick health check on operational trackers to find broken formulas.

prompt_templates.title: Basic recalculation
prompt_templates.prompt: Recalculate formulas in output.xlsx and report any Excel errors.

prompt_templates.title: Timeout control
prompt_templates.prompt: Recalculate finance_model.xlsx with a 60 second timeout and summarize errors.

prompt_templates.title: Error-focused report
prompt_templates.prompt: Run recalc on budget.xlsx and list #REF and #DIV/0 locations.

prompt_templates.title: Formula inventory
prompt_templates.prompt: Recalculate ops.xlsx and report total formulas and any error categories.

output_examples.input: Recalculate sales_report.xlsx and show any formula errors.

best_practices: Run recalculation after any formula or data edits
Fix reported error locations before publishing the file
Use a longer timeout for large workbooks
anti_patterns: Running recalculation on files without LibreOffice installed
Ignoring errors and sharing the workbook
Assuming formulas were evaluated by openpyxl

faq.question: What file types are supported?
faq.answer: The script targets Excel .xlsx files and uses LibreOffice to recalculate formulas.

faq.question: Is there a limit on workbook size?
faq.answer: Very large files can exceed the timeout, so increase the timeout value when needed.

faq.question: Can I integrate this into a pipeline?
faq.answer: Yes, call recalc.py in your workflow and parse the JSON output for errors.

faq.question: Does it send my data anywhere?
faq.answer: No, it operates locally and does not perform network calls.

faq.question: What if LibreOffice is not found?
faq.answer: Install LibreOffice and ensure the soffice command is available on your system PATH.

faq.question: How does this compare to Excel recalculation?
faq.answer: It uses LibreOffice headless mode, which is suitable for automation without opening Excel.
